metadata.title: CVE-2013-2131 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
Format string vulnerability in the rrdtool module 1.4.7 for Python, as used in Zenoss, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via format string specifiers to the rrdtool.graph function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2013-2131` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

librrd8 - 1.7.2-3build6
librrdp-perl - 1.7.2-3build6
librrds-perl - 1.7.2-3build6
lua-rrd - 1.7.2-3build6
python3-rrdtool - 1.7.2-3build6
rrdcached - 1.7.2-3build6
rrdtool - 1.7.2-3build6
rrdtool-tcl - 1.7.2-3build6
ruby-rrd - 1.7.2-3build6
No subscription required

notes.note: rodrigo-zaiden> xenial was patched in release version 1.4.8-1, and later it was upgraded to the new upstream version 1.5 that already has the fix (no need to add an explict patch). Since then, every Ubuntu release already has the fix applied.

criterions.comment: rrdtool package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.2-3build6').
